# Analysis of Target Structure

## Description of the Main Target Image:
The image shows two structures made of colored building blocks:

**Left Structure (3 layers, 4 blocks total):**
- Top: Red hollow block with a semi-circular cutout
- Middle: Green horizontal rectangular block with a blue cube block positioned to the left
- Bottom: Red hollow block with a semi-circular cutout (mirror of the top block)

**Right Structure (5 layers, 6 blocks total):**
- Top: Red hollow block with a semi-circular cutout
- 2nd layer: Green horizontal rectangular block
- 3rd layer: Blue cube on the left side, yellow cube on the right side
- 4th layer: Green horizontal rectangular block
- Bottom layer: Red hollow block with a semi-circular cutout (mirror of the top block)

## Block Selection from Dictionary:
Examining the block dictionary, I can identify the required blocks:

**For Left Structure:**
- Top: Block #1 (Red arch block with cutout facing right)
- Middle: Block #12 (Green horizontal rectangle)
- Middle-left: Block #7 (Blue cube)
- Bottom: Block #4 (Red C-shaped block with opening to the left)

**For Right Structure:**
- Top: Block #1 (Red arch block with cutout facing right)
- 2nd layer: Block #12 (Green horizontal rectangle)
- 3rd layer left: Block #7 (Blue cube)
- 3rd layer right: Block #11 (Yellow cube)
- 4th layer: Block #12 (Green horizontal rectangle) - using this block again
- Bottom: Block #4 (Red C-shaped block with opening to the left)

## Assembly Order:

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 4
   Step2: Move block with index 12
   Step3: Move block with index 7
   Step4: Move block with index 1
   Step5: Move block with index 4
   Step6: Move block with index 12
   Step7: Move block with index 7
   Step8: Move block with index 11
   Step9: Move block with index 12
   Step10: Move block with index 1
}
```

This assembly order builds the structures from bottom to top, starting with the left structure (steps 1-4) and then creating the right structure (steps 5-10).
